title: Fehlian released
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317111932im_/http:/typophile.com/files/schild_Fehlian_4T_5111.png)

I take the pleasure to announce the release of [FEHLIAN](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317111932/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/andreas-stotzner/fehlian/), a caps-only titling font. It owes much to my former Arthur and Lindau releases.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317111932im_/http:/typophile.com/files/schild_Fehlian_8T_4041.png)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317111932im_/http:/typophile.com/files/schild_Fehlian_2T_5545.png)
author: Andreas Stötzner

comments.content: I didn't realize this was a new design, but earlier today I went through all your typefaces on MyFonts and saved each picture to my computer. Your designs are very impressive. I was surprised to see this much decoration and sophistication thereof inside the letters of Fehlian. Generally these decorations tend to be uninspired.

thank you Martin.  
I have a special affinity to ornaments, always had it. And to 1930ies, 40ies, 50ies embellishment styles in particular. Therefore I return to this kind of work from time to time. Though doing ornated letters of this kind is a bit cumbersome to execute …
Many of your typefaces seem cumbersome to execute, to me.
Nice! The fine piping somehow feels more natural here than in Arthur. Maybe because it tapers?

thanks gentlemen.  
Compared to Arthur, this has certainly more dynamic, strength and juicyness, maybe a more natural appeal. Arthur Sans is just utterly decadent. ;)
